paper_metadata.title: Social protection programs are not introduced in a vacuum: The effects of Ghana's LEAP 1000 program on social support

program_information.target_population: pregnant women and mothers of children under one year living in poverty

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The program creates a reliable source of complementary income, alongside income from agricultural and non-agricultural livelihood activities | an unconditional cash transfer program

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Using a difference-in-differences approach we find that LEAP 1000 increases overall social support, as well as both emotional and instrumental support. In addition, program beneficiaries are more likely to participate in community groups.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We use data from the quasi-experimental mixed method impact evaluation of Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) 1000 program

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: In in-depth interviews, participants confirmed increased support with descriptions of improved access to financial markets

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: We use data from the quasi-experimental mixed method impact evaluation of Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) 1000 program
evidence_citations.country_citation: We use data from the quasi-experimental mixed method impact evaluation of Ghana's Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) 1000 program
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: a social cash transfer program for pregnant women and mothers of children under one year living in poverty
